AudioHandler Class¶

class src.main.python.player.AudioHandler.AudioHandler(queue)[source]¶

Bases: threading.Thread

Controlls how the music is being played. Will spawn instances of src.main.python.player.PlayStream for each song. Handles the src.main.python.player.ConditionObject in response to INET server commands. Determines playback from the music database also handles by the HTTP server. Has self.daemon = True.

Parameters:queue (queue.Queue) – queue to get new INET server commands.
get_path_from_database()[source]¶

Queries the songs table with src.main.python.flaskserv.Database.MusicDB to determine information on the next song to play given the song id from self.fetch_playlist_item().

Returns:the path to the most voted song
Return type:str
pause(*args)[source]¶

Pause the playback – calls src.main.python.player.ConditionObject.toggle_pause() on own instance.

play(*args)[source]¶

Begin the playback – first checks if *args contains a path, else calls self.get_path_from_database() to fetch a song path. Then checks if the file exists, returns None if false. Stops the current playback if a player exists by calling self.stop(). Creates a new src.main.python.player.PlayStream instance, loads the song and starts the playback. Finally, sets self.curret_player to new instance.

resume(*args)[source]¶

TODO

run()[source]¶

Inherited and overwritten threading.Thread.run(); called when self.start() method is invoked. Checks if a new message has been received in self.queue, and if so, acts upon it. Else, checks if current playback has finished, i.e. ConditionObject.done == True, in which case tries to fetch a new item from the playlist table in the database, and if one exists, will play most voted song.

stop(*args)[source]¶

Sets the current instace of src.main.python.player.ConditionObject.play to False, then spawns fresh instance and sets self.current_player to None.
